Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from some twenty-five fragments and added plaster) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below, with two added white bands; exterior: at rim, band of single oblique dots between lines; below, hook maeander frieze; below from left, part of large maeander square; vertical dividing band of dots between single lines; paired hook maeanders between lines; at right, goose (part of head and tail feathers remaining) to right; pendant corner roundel as filling ornament; inscription on interior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The number 931 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 389)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0093) (phase 2)
